definition: to be totally dispersed (crowd)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: In the night of the last chapter, all those sweet incense.
sentences.chinese: 在夜的最后一章，散尽了那段甜甜的香。

sentences.english: To get Tutti back, Wayan had to hire a lawyer, whom she paid with every single thing she had.
sentences.chinese: 为了争取图蒂，大姐必须散尽所有的一切去聘请律师。

sentences.english: Dark clouds of the sky, snow-capped mountains still holy.
sentences.chinese: 乌云散尽，雪山依然圣洁。

sentences.english: At last a great sad face looked out of the vapor.
sentences.chinese: 最后云气散尽，出现了一张巨大的脸，神情沮丧。

definition: to dissipate
whole sky
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
instantly/in no time
nearly exhausted/practically nothing left
the clouds melt and the mists disperse (idiom)/to clear up/to vanish into thin air
to waft (through the air)/to drift
to go up in smoke/to vanish
to spring up everywhere/from all around
to change into/to turn into/to become
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to soar/to rocket
to vanish gradually/to disappear/to fade out
to take off (one's clothes)/(fig.) to shed (one's former image etc)/(of a fad or the after-effects of a disaster etc) to subside/also pr. [tun4 qu4]
to disperse
to eliminate
